snippet: Tunisia received $28.8 million on Thursday in the first such retrieval of what it called looted assets held abroad by former President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali.
abstract: Tunisia receives $28.8 million in the first such retrieval of what it calls looted assets held abroad by former Pres Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali and his family; billions of dollars acquired corruptly by Ben Ali, who fled to Saudi Arabia after being ousted from power, remain unaccounted for.
lead_paragraph: Tunisia received $28.8 million on Thursday in the first such retrieval of what it called looted assets held abroad by former President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali.

headline.seo: Tunisia: Millions Recovered From Ex-Leader’s Assets
headline.main: Tunisia: Millions Recovered From Ex-Leader’s Assets
headline.print_headline: Tunisia: Millions Recovered From Ex-Leader’s Assets
